election_record.label: Massachusetts 1805 House of Representatives, Thomaston, Ballot 4

overview.note: "In May, after two unsuccessful trials for the choice of Representative, in which the Federal votes were divided between Gen. Henry Knox and Esq. Joshua Adams, and after once voting not to send a Representative, this vote was reconsidered at an adjourned meeting and Dr. Isaac Bernard, a Republican was elected by 99 votes, against 88 for Joshua Adams; the name of Knox having been withdrawn." History of Thomaston, Rockland and South Thomaston, Maine, Vol. I. 260-261.

election_record.reference: Eaton, Cyrus. History of Thomaston, Rockland and South Thomaston, Maine. Vol. 1. Hallowell, ME: Masters, Smith and, 1865. 260-261.
